weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon presents a crisp, clear tableau under a bright sun, its rays falling softly on the city as temperatures begin to embrace a mild chill. The forecast speaks of highs near 66 degrees, but the breeze, brisk and spirited, whispers of the impending dip into the 50s as the day wanes. Gusts of wind, playful yet assertive at 25 mph, add a lively touch to the scenery, tugging gently at the edges of jackets and scarves as one ventures outside. 

As twilight approaches, expect a gentle transition, with partly cloudy skies shifting to reveal a landscape draped in twilight hues. The temperature will settle around 50 degrees, creeping slightly upward as the night unfolds. Those heading out should consider dressing in layers—light enough to enjoy the day but ample enough to counter the evening chill. With such weather, the streets whisper of leisurely strolls along the waterfront, perhaps a stop at a local café to savor a warm drink while considering the subtle grace of the evening as it envelops the city.
